access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient downloads a generic Release of Information PDF form, fills it out designating themselves as the recipient, and faxes it to the clinic.

red_flags: Newer form (12/2023) regressed from fillable to non-fillable format
Two active forms with same REG number and no guidance on which to use
bright_spots: Encrypted email delivery option for records
'Self/Personal' purpose checkbox explicitly supports patient-directed requests
Granular behavioral health record type selection (Mental Health, Substance Use, Psychiatry separately)

findability.rationale: Level 4: Both forms are easily discoverable via basic web search with direct PDF links on a clearly labeled medical records page; minor deduction for two active forms with no guidance on which is current.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: A fillable PDF exists (form-2, 54 fields) and fax submission is available (form-1), but the current primary form is not fillable and the fillable form lacks submission instructions â€” requiring workarounds across two documents.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Numbered sections provide reasonable structure and record-type granularity is strong, but dense single-page layout, legalese consent paragraphs, and visually interleaved sections on form-2 create notable clarity problems.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the generic ROI form with the 'Self/Personal' checkbox, but the FROM/TO framing is designed for inter-organizational transfers and there is no dedicated patient access pathway or Right of Access language.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No notarization, no in-person requirement, clear treatment non-conditioning and revocation statements, appropriate expiration; minor ambiguities include no fee disclosure and a confusing 42 CFR Part 2/HIPAA conflation.

overall.summary: NorthLakes Community Clinic provides easily findable, barrier-free generic ROI forms with good record-type granularity, but lacks a dedicated patient access pathway and regressed from fillable to non-fillable on its current form.
